data.title: Laurent Ferrier Archives
data.text:
Laurent Ferrier Classic Micro-Rotor with Salmon Dial Reviewed by Tim Mosso

///

Watches like this Classic Micro-Rotor leave Tim Mosso wondering why Laurent Ferrier doesn’t have a queue two years long awaiting delivery of its products. On substance, this LF offers world-beating quality.

https://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/Laurent-Ferrier_Classic-Micro-Rotor_5668.jpg 1601 1600 Tim Mosso http://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/logo-header-scroll-qandp-335x193.png Tim Mosso2024-03-09 18:05:002024-03-10 19:04:02Laurent Ferrier Classic Micro-Rotor with Salmon Dial Reviewed by Tim Mosso

50 Shades Of Pink: Salmon Dials Go From Strength To Strength – Reprise

///

Salmon-colored dials are still niche market and Martin Green doesn’t expect them to go mainstream anytime soon. Nonetheless, pink has become something of a buzz topic, and here he shares a few of his favorite watches with pink, pinkish, or salmon-colored dials.

https://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/A.-Lange-Söhne-Datograph-Perpetual-Tourbillon-9W0B8395.jpg 1600 1145 Martin Green http://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/logo-header-scroll-qandp-335x193.png Martin Green2023-03-17 04:15:002023-03-18 08:21:1650 Shades Of Pink: Salmon Dials Go From Strength To Strength – Reprise

3 New Tourbillons From Watches & Wonders 2020: A Pursuit Of Personal Passion

///

Here are three intriguing tourbillons by Laurent Ferrier, Vacheron Constantin, and Piaget from the digital Watches & Wonders 2020 fair that particularly caught Martin Green’s critical eye.

https://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/laurent-ferrier-grand-sport-tourbillon.jpg 1600 1600 Martin Green http://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/logo-header-scroll-qandp-335x193.png Martin Green2020-09-01 22:36:172020-09-03 07:48:443 New Tourbillons From Watches & Wonders 2020: A Pursuit Of Personal Passion

Laurent Ferrier Galet Annual Calendar Montre École: Back To School

///

Laurent Ferrier won the award for best Men’s Complication watch at the 2018 Grand Prix d’Horlogerie de Genève for the Galet Annual Calendar Montre École, an imagining of an annual calendar based on Monsieur Ferrier’s original ‘montre école’ (final exam watch). Joshua Munchow appreciates the watch’s simplicity and legibility and feels that it’s a perfect example of what an annual calendar can be.

https://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Laurent-Ferrier-Galet-Annual-Calendar-Montre-Ecole-9W0B7879.jpg 1600 1600 Joshua Munchow http://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/logo-header-scroll-qandp-335x193.png Joshua Munchow2018-12-30 21:39:302024-03-07 09:56:11Laurent Ferrier Galet Annual Calendar Montre École: Back To School

The Schmidt List: Top 5 Funky Clicks

///

The click spring is one of the smaller components of a mechanical watch, but it is of enormous importance. Ever wondered why the crown doesn’t retaliate furiously and unwind every time you crank it? Without the click spring, a wound mainspring would immediately – and explosively – uncoil like a raging viper in a hat box.

https://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Laurent-Ferrier-Galet-Tourbillon_click_2586.jpg 687 1030 Ryan Schmidt http://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/logo-header-scroll-qandp-335x193.png Ryan Schmidt2017-09-16 17:59:562018-12-27 18:39:29The Schmidt List: Top 5 Funky Clicks

Laurent Ferrier x Urwerk Arpal One For Only Watch 2017: The Past, Present, And Future Of Horology In One Unique Watch (First Live Photos)

///

There are 50 unique timepieces being auctioned at Only Watch 2017, each exceptional in some way. But three of these timepieces stand out as being more unique than the rest in that they are not simply unique variations of existing watches, but the culmination of completely one-off projects. By far the shiniest of these is the Laurent Ferrier x Urwerk Arpal One.

https://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Laurent-FerrierxUrwerk-OW17_1.jpg 1291 1200 Ian Skellern http://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/logo-header-scroll-qandp-335x193.png Ian Skellern2017-09-08 18:08:102019-09-17 11:36:05Laurent Ferrier x Urwerk Arpal One For Only Watch 2017: The Past, Present, And Future Of Horology In One Unique Watch (First Live Photos)

My 2017 SIHH Highlights, Shot With A Leica Q

///

At the 2017 SIHH in Geneva I particularly liked the Carré des Horlogers, as the SIHH independents’ hall is known, which showcases some of the industry’s finest creative minds producing amazing watches, both traditional and contemporary. So without further ado, here are my SIHH highlights, most of which come from that hall.

https://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Urwerk-UR-T8_wrist_L1140540.jpg 800 1200 Simon Cudd http://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/logo-header-scroll-qandp-335x193.png Simon Cudd2017-03-08 18:40:302019-01-02 09:54:11My 2017 SIHH Highlights, Shot With A Leica Q

SIHH 2017 Round Table: What We Liked And What We Didn’t Like (Warning: Modem-Burning Photo Fest!)

///

Please join our Quill & Pad round table discussion, where we talk about what we did and didn’t like at the 2017 SIHH (Salon International de la Haute Horlogerie). And get ready for a cornucopia of beautiful photos and colorful opinions!

https://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Ulysse-Nardin-Innovision2_wrist_170654.jpg 1200 1200 Elizabeth Doerr http://quillandpad.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/logo-header-scroll-qandp-335x193.png Elizabeth Doerr2017-01-25 19:22:292018-12-22 19:47:03SIHH 2017 Round Table: What We Liked And What We Didn’t Like (Warning: Modem-Burning Photo Fest!)
